questions.question: How do you assign the network ID for each subnet?
options: By using the subnet increment (subnet jump)
By using the number of hosts
questions.answer: By using the subnet increment (subnet jump)

questions.question: How do you determine the host IP range in a subnet?
options: By finding addresses between the network ID and broadcast ID
By adding borrow bits to subnet mask
questions.answer: By finding addresses between the network ID and broadcast ID

questions.question: How can you easily find the broadcast ID of a subnet?
options: It is one less than the next subnet’s network ID
It is the first address of a subnet
It is calculated using borrow bits
It is the sum of host bits
questions.answer: It is one less than the next subnet’s network ID
